author: jonpaul
title: 3D printer hardware interface
description: 物理的な世界では、カルダノには十分な経済的機会がない

f6_assessments.q0: Bringing "enough" opportunity "with Cardano in the physical world" is arguable in terms of generating impact and being a need from the community. It's advisable that the proposer explores in the proposal's details how this actually means impact for the Cardano community and how his problem is actually a problem in the community.
f6_assessments.q1: The budget is a bit high and the proposers have indicated no quality indicators or uniqueness of their solution. In addition, the idea of a printed NFT is not well explained, it's difficult to assert the proposal's success from the way it's presented.
f6_assessments.q2: There's a roadmap and milestones that allow the project to be audited but it needs to bring clarification of how it will really impact the community beyond another 3D printer in the market. It can be audited, but its success it's questionable.
f6_assessments.reply: I think more utility is a problem for the crypto world in general if we want larger adoption and impact, especially in developing nations. Part of expanding utility is to add something like 3d printing (which already exists in other forms), but allow people to earn from both selling designs and printing them. Which is where a low cost printer interface would come in. However, I can see how this is not well explored or explained in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: There is an inescapable need for this hardware to popularise 3D NFTs. This is a niche collectible area, but with immense potential. The NFTs in the 3D form will be having a major role in the "metaverse" setting which might become a reality sooner than we imagine.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has provided his Linkedin profile and is a SpaceX designer who had exhibited a passion for robotics and related areas. Considering these credentials, I believe that the proposers will be able to complete the proposal in time.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget breakdown and the roadmap are implementable. The final output will be phototype and open design specifications which can be used to create more devices. The proposers claim that the end device will be less than $200 in cost hence will be a very marketable product.

f6_assessments.q0: Relation to personal qualifications: I have an understanding of budgeting, both due to my past engagement as a treasurer in a political organisation and my current work as a project engineer, which will give me a good grasp of realistic budgeting of projects. The proposal identifies an interesting new approach to NFTs that will make them accessible to a broader spectrum of people and will add value to the Cardano ecosystem it aligns with the very open challenge settings minly by adressing NFTs. Scalability is not further adressed in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
With their acclaimed professional expertise, as an engineer myself I can tell that they are most likely up for the challenge and that the type and number of team members defined is sufficient to implement the proposal.
The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items
and seems reasonable to achieve the set goals.
The proposal offers a brief, however realistic timetable to complete the work.
The implementation and follow-up-plan could be more detailed.
The resources necessary to implement the proposal are described sufficiently.
Some more background information and technical aspects are explained on the adosia website. What is a bit lacking is an analysis of potential risks during implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: An understandable problem and sollution description are supplemented well by some concrete figures of what is going to be achieved. All in all I consider this proposal to be quite auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: Remember Adosia from way back. Was wondering how things are going on with them, then out of the blue this gem of an idea. This proposal definitely fits with this Challenge setting, which is to find those misfits that seek to change the world. And these guys are onto something here. Having the capability to have a physical version of an NFT is still a niche road that only a few are yet currently exploring. Exploring in terms of how or if it adds value to the NFT by having capability to have it's physical version. One avenue that would most likely benefit from this is product miniatures. BANDAI, the largest anime merchandiser is exploring blockchain and NFT this very minute. Now imagine BANDAI, made available a one-of-a-kind NFT of a skin of an anime character that is only available for one day. That NFT can also be 3-D printed to be added on to that baseline character. That is a potential lucrative business model and I am up for taking a calculated gamble on Adosia.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers track record that is stated in their proposal, their LinkedIn profile which is situated in the comment section and their track record with Adosia, instills me with confidence this proposal will indeed be implemented successfully. The budget provided is detailed and does have to a certain extent action plans. Would have been great if it were to be more fleshed out or given more rationale since the budget asked is quite considerable. Implementation plan although existent is quite basic for the feat this proposal is trying to achieve. There is also no consideration of the potentially huge risk and challenge this proposer will face. Please do not let complacency be the factor that makes this proposal not receive the appreciation it rightfully deserves but from the looks of things, it will. To the proposer, CA's now have up their game from waaay back. Please do contact the Catalyst School to update yourself on what are the current best practices on formulating a proposal. I am your potentially number 1 fan, but unfortunately, with all the data you have given, it would be a risk to fund. Please come back, and when this printer takes shape, I will definitely use it.
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap and milestones are unfortunately basic, it need to be fleshed out more so CA's can be taken on your 'journey'. KPI's are to an extent not formulated. Making this proposal risky and challenging to audit. Problem statement is not solid, though the solution is. There is interconnection between the two resulting in this proposal. Please do take my advice and contact Catalyst School. I personally will contact you to help with formulating a (hopefully) CA proof proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
"It is extremely exciting to help NFT products on current blockchain platforms securely turn into physical products. But I have yet to see it have any impact on the real world or on the blockchain other than it could become an item of enjoyment for the owner of that NFT. Because a digital picture or a digital item when made into physical products by 3D printing technology does not solve anything.

Currently, NFT is mostly only applied in the field of gamefi. Making it possible for the NFT to be used to verify physical assets is a great thing. If this proposal can work towards solving this, it will have a huge impact"
f6_assessments.q1:
"The team behind the proposal are SpaceX design engineers with 11 years of experience designing 3D printed parts and this proposal is part of the Adosia team that is working on IoT devices. So I think they are fully capable of implementing this proposal without any difficulty. The project implementation period of about 1 year is a period that is appropiate with the goals of the proposal.
"
f6_assessments.q2:
"I haven't seen the proposer outline how we can follow up on this proposal. So it is very difficult for us to check whether the proposal's workflow is completed or not.

In my opinion, being able to update the information about their software on github is a great way for people to follow the proposal. In addition, the team can also make videos about the products and the team's working process to report the results in the most intuitive way."
f6_assessments.reply: In response to the impact/alignment I do not see 3d printed parts currently having much value in developed nations, but I think it could have lots of potential in places where cheap goods are less accessible. Having 3d designs be an NFT that can be printed should help designers be able to monetize their work, and thus be able to put more effort into coming up with unique solutions to real world problems. However, I agree this is not well written out on the proposal and is betting on future innovation to have high impact.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about building an inexpensive 3D printer hardware interface that will allow artists and builders to directly print 3D NFTs. The proposed solution is clearly described [with a specific roadmap, budget distribution]. As a result, there is proof that it addresses this challenge and it shows the potential impact on the Cardano ecosystem as a whole. Therefore, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q1: Team's [from Adosia Project] profile is briefly provided, shows suitable skill, and experiences for implementation, with an external link [Github]for verifying. The plan was quite well-prepared, with the budget distribution, specific roadmap, but without KPIs, and risk management. Therefore, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 4
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provided plenty of info, with proof for verification. However, for better understanding, (1) KPIs/metrics, (2) Risk management should be provided. Based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 3

f6_assessments.q0: During my assessment, I couldn't get the slightest connection to Cardano which was set to be at least slightly connecting with on the challenge set. The proposal could have found a way of presenting the connection to Cardano blockchain in a different manner.
f6_assessments.q1: Experience listed on the proposal stands out as a really good capability of implementing the project but fails to support the experience with a well-put plan that can show the success of the proposal when it reaches to the implementation phase.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditing the progress and the success of this proposal is definitely going to be the hardest part because the proposal has no way of informing the readers about auditable progress that a reader can read ahead. I consider this as a major failure for this proposal because it gives out the impression that it is not well prepared.
f6_assessments.reply:
Connection is through the larger Adosia project that is linked. This should have been better explained on this specific proposal.

Will look into better reporting progress for this project and future ones.

solution: アーティストやビルダーが3D NFTを直接プリントできるようにする、安価な3Dプリンタのハードウェアインターフェース
experience: SpaceX社の設計エンジニア2名（合計11年の経験を持つ）が、3Dプリント部品の設計と製造までのサポートを行います。
